name: Leftover-Salmon Noodle Casserole
author: Rachel_Jernigan_Power
summary: This was a complete throw-together-on-the-fly dinner one night. I was so pleased with how it turned out that I decided to post it. It's quick, it's rib sticking ... it's pretty good! Perfect served with a salad or a vegetable of your choice.
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 cup crushed cheese-flavored snack chips (such as Sunchips®)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Coat a 9x11-inch baking dish with cooking spray
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes
Combine  , condensed mushroom soup, cream, and 2 tablespoons parsley in a large pot and bring to a simmer, about 5 minutes
Fold in cooked macaroni and salmon
Spoon mixture into the prepared baking dish
Top with Cheddar cheese followed by crushed chips
Bake in the preheated oven until melty and bubbly, about 15 minutes
